intro: Viola canina var. procera, commonly known as the tall dog violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow throat, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, woodland soils and is often found in shaded, temperate environments. This variety is noted for its taller stature compared to the standard Viola canina.
